radiographic_examinations.findings: Mildly dilated left ventricle (LV) with moderately to severely decreased LV systolic function (ejection fraction (EF) 25%-35%) and a moderate-size defect communicating the aortic root and the right ventricle. Continuous flow on Doppler interrogation between the aortic root and the RV was observed.

Moderate RV dilatation (end-diastolic volume (EDV) index of 145 ml/m2), severe RV dysfunction (EF 25%), mild LV dilatation (EDV index 117 ml/m2) with global hypokinesis, and moderate to severe LV dysfunction (EF 33%). Severe calculated aortic regurgitation (regurgitant fraction 70% by phase contrast) was revealed without significant visual aortic insufficiency.
Confirmed the finding of a sinus of Valsalva aneurysm rupture (SOVAR) with a large shunt with continuous flow between the noncoronary sinus of Valsalva and the RV.

Normal coronary arteries, elevated RV (50/12 mmHg) and pulmonary artery (PA) pressures (55/22, mean 33 mmHg), normal cardiac output (5.2 L/min, 2.8 L/min/m2), normal pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) of 1.7 Wood Units (WU), and a large left-to-right shunt with a Qp/Qs ratio of 2.1:1.
